VEGAN ORANGE CREAMSICLE POPSICLES 🍊 Made with just 5-ingredients and honestly one of my favorite summer treats 😛 The full recipe is below and also available on my blog, link in my bio 🙏🏼 or head to https://user_34.com/2019/08/orange-creamsicle-popsicles/⁣ ⁣ ⁣ PS: music is from @d.a.j.u — check him out on SoundCloud “Itsdaju”🙃 ⁣ Ingredients⁣ * 1 1/4 cups orange juice (we recommend fresh)⁣ * 1 cup raw cashews, soaked⁣ * 1 cup water or unsweetened plain almond milk⁣ * 1/4 cup maple syrup⁣ * 1 teaspoon vanilla extract⁣ * Optional: 1 teaspoon orange zest (for additional orange flavor)⁣ * Optional: 1 teaspoon ground turmeric (just for additional color)⁣ * Optional: 1/4 teaspoon salt⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. Bring a small pot of water to a boil. Once boiling, remove the pot from heat and add in the raw cashews. Allow the cashews to soak until softened, about 20-30 minutes. Drain the cashews.⁣ 2. Add all of the ingredients for the orange creamsicles into a high speed blender and blend until smooth, about 1 minute.⁣ 3. Evenly distribute the mixture into 10 popsicle molds. Tap the popsicle molds onto the counter a few times to remove any air bubbles. Place the popsicles into the freezer and allow them to set until solid, ideally overnight.⁣ 4. To remove the popsicles from the mold, submerge the mold into a bowl of warm (not hot) water for about 30-40 seconds (longer if necessary depending on the warmth of the water). Gently wiggle the popsicles out of the mold to prevent them from cracking.⁣ Enjoy!⁣ ⁣ #user_34 #orangecreamsicle #summerecipes #veganorangecreamsicle #cashewcream #veganrecipes #popsicles

SKILLET BISCUIT POT PIE 😍 This recipe has been a big hit on the blog and for good reason 😛 it’s easy to make and only takes about 30 minutes to put together! Plus it’s damnnnn good if I do say so myself 💁🏽‍♀️ The recipe is down below and also up on our blog via the link in my bio, enjoy ❤️ ⁣ Ingredients⁣ * 1/2 cup vegan butter⁣ * 1 medium onion, finely diced⁣ * 3 cloves garlic, finely minced⁣ * 2 ribs celery, finely diced⁣ * 1/2 medium russet potato, peeled and diced (about 1 1/2 cups) ⁣ * 1/2 cup all-purpose flour* (see notes for GF options)⁣ * 2 cups vegetable broth⁣ * 1 cup unsweetened almond milk (or plant-based milk of your choice)⁣ * 2 tbsp freshly chopped parsley⁣ * 2 tsp thyme leaves⁣ * 1 cup frozen broccoli⁣ * 1 cup mixed frozen vegetables⁣ * Salt and pepper, as desired⁣ * 1 (8-count) tube of refrigerated canned biscuits* (we used the flaky kind; see notes)⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat. ⁣ 2. Heat a large oven safe skillet or saucepan over medium heat and add the vegan butter. If your pan is not oven safe, no worries! Set aside a medium-sized oven safe baking dish for later. Melt the vegan butter and then add in the onions, garlic and celery. Sauté for 3 minutes, stirring frequently.⁣ 3. Add the diced potatoes and cook for 3 minutes more.⁣ 4. Remove the biscuits from the refrigerator and place them on the baking sheet. Bake for 9 minutes (or half of the time required on the package).⁣ 5. Gradually mix in the flour, a tablespoon or two at a time, until fully combined. Cook for 2 minutes.⁣ 6. Add in the broth, almond milk, parsley, thyme, and black pepper, and then cook for about 3 minutes. Lastly add in the broccoli and mixed frozen vegetables and bring everything to a boil. Lower the heat to a simmer and cook for  an additional 3-4 minutes. Season with salt to taste.⁣ ⁣ (CONTINUED IN COMMENTS) #user_34 #skilletpotpie https://user_34.com/2020/04/skillet-biscuit-pot-pie

GRILLED VEGETABLE SALAD 🥗 with spiced chickpeas and our 5-minute tahini dressing 😍 We cooked up the chickpeas on the grill, too! 🙏🏼 I’ll share our recipe below + you can find it on our on blog via the link in my bio ❤️ ⁣ ⁣ Ingredients⁣ Tahini Dressing⁣ *1/3 cup tahini⁣ *2-3 tbsp lemon juice⁣ *2 tsp Dijon mustard⁣ *1 1/2 tsp maple syrup⁣ *1-1 1/2 tsp tamari (or soy sauce)⁣ *1 tsp garlic powder⁣ *1/3 to 1/2 cup water, or as needed to thin⁣ *Salt and pepper, to taste⁣ Salad⁣ *1 bunch kale, stems removed and roughly chopped⁣ *2 bell peppers, cut into thick slices⁣ *1 large zucchini, cut into thick rounds⁣ *1 bunch asparagus, ends removed⁣ *4 oz. crimini mushrooms, cut into thick slices⁣ *2 ears corn, shucked⁣ *4 lemons, halved⁣ Chickpeas⁣ *1 (15.5 oz) can chickpeas, drained and rinsed⁣ *1/2 tsp each of ground cumin, chili powder and garlic powder⁣ *1/4 tsp each of smoked paprika and onion powder⁣ *Salt and pepper, as desired⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. Dressing: In a medium bowl, whisk together all of the ingredients except for the water and salt and pepper until smooth. Add about 1/4 cup of water at a time, whisking thoroughly until smooth, until the dressing reaches your desired consistency. Taste and adjust seasonings as desired.⁣ 2. Greens: Place the kale into a large salad bowl along with about 1/2 of the tahini dressing. Using clean hands, massage the tahini into the kale by scrunching up large handfuls at a time until the kale softens and the tahini is well incorporated. Add more tahini dressing as needed or desired. Set aside.⁣ 3. Vegetables: Preheat your grill on medium heat for 10 minutes. We didn’t use oil but you can oil it if you’d like. Alternatively you can preheat an oiled grill pan on high. Add the vegetables and cook, turning often, until they are charred to your liking, about 10-20 minutes depending on the grill and vegetables. Some vegetables will cook faster than others depending on their size and variety.⁣ ⁣ (Continued in comments below)⁣ ⁣ https://user_34.com/2020/05/grilled-vegetable-salad-chickpeas-tahini-dressing/⁣ #user_34 #grillrecipe #grilledsalad #grilledvegetables #vegangrillrecipes

One-Pot Red Curry Peanut Ramen 🍜 ready in just 30-minutes?! Yes please! We have been obsessed with this recipe and have made it twice in the past week 😅 It’s so good + very customizable. The recipe is below and also on our blog, linked in my bio ❤️⁣ ⁣ RECIPE:⁣ * 2 tbsp sesame oil⁣ * 1 block extra firm tofu, pressed and cubed* (see notes)⁣ * 3 cloves garlic, finely minced⁣ * 2 green onions, sliced⁣ * 1-inch fresh ginger, grated⁣ * 1/4 cup Thai red curry paste* (see notes)⁣ * 4 large bok choy, chopped⁣ * 4-ounces baby Bella mushrooms, sliced⁣ * 4 cups vegetable broth⁣ * 1 (14-ounce) can coconut milk⁣ * 1/3 cup unsweetened smooth peanut butter⁣ * 2 tbsp soy sauce (or tamari if gluten-free)⁣ * 1 tbsp + 1 tsp agave nectar (or liquid sweetener of choice, see notes)⁣ * 8.5-ounces uncooked ramen noodles* (see notes)⁣ * Salt and pepper, to taste⁣ * Juice of 1 large lime (about 2 tbsp), or to taste⁣ Top with⁣ * 2 medium carrots, julienned⁣ * Toasted sesame seeds and/or chopped peanuts⁣ * Cilantro, chopped⁣ * Green onions, chopped⁣ ⁣ 1. In a large pot over medium-high heat, add 1 tbsp of sesame oil. Once heated, add the tofu and cook until golden, about 7 minutes. Remove the tofu and set aside.⁣ 2. Add the remaining sesame oil along with the garlic, onions and ginger. Cook until fragrant, or about 1 minute.⁣ 3. Add the red curry paste and cook for a minute or so, until fragrant & evenly coats the veggies.⁣ 4. Add the box choy and mushrooms and cook for about 1-2 minutes, or until they begin to soften.⁣ 5. Add the broth, coconut milk, peanut butter, soy sauce, and agave, & mix until uniform. Keep in mind the peanut butter will begin to “melt” into the broth as it heats. Taste & add additional curry paste if desired.⁣ 6. Cover the pot and bring to a boil.⁣ 7. Once boiling, remove the lid, add the ramen & cook according to the directions on the package, stirring often.⁣ 8. Remove from heat and stir in the lime juice. Season with salt and pepper & adjust any other ingredients to taste.⁣ 9. Serve with toppings of choice & enjoy!⁣ ⁣ (NOTES IN COMMENTS)⁣ https://user_34.com/2020/05/one-pot-red-curry-peanut-ramen/⁣ #vegan #user_34 #feedfeed #feedfeedvevan

Creamy One-Pot Taco Pasta 🌮🍝 You seemed to love our recipes last week for our little challenge, so we decided to put them up on the blog! The ramen will be out tomorrow 🙏🏼⁣ ⁣ The recipe is below and also on our blog, link in my bio 😍⁣ ⁣ Ingredients⁣ * 1/2 cup yellow onion, finely diced⁣ * 2 cloves garlic, minced⁣ * 1 pound vegan grounds (we used @beyondmeat)⁣ * 1 tablespoon taco seasoning⁣ * 2 cups vegetable broth ⁣ * 1 cup salsa⁣ of your choice * 1 (15.5 oz.) can of black beans, drained and rinsed⁣ * 1 cup frozen corn⁣ * 1 cup taco sauce of your choice (we used @skyvalleyfoods)⁣ * 2 cups pasta (we used rotini)⁣ * 1 cup vegan cheese shreds (we used @followyourheart cheddar)⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. To a lightly oiled medium sized pot, add in the onion and garlic. Cook for about 2-3 minutes until garlic is fragrant and onions translucent.⁣ 2. Add in vegan grounds and taco seasoning, mix through, and cool until grounds have browned, about 5 minutes. ⁣ 3. Add in the vegetable broth, salsa, black beans, tadco sauce and corn. Stir well, then add in the uncooked pasta.⁣ 4. Bring mixture to a boil and then lower to low-medium heat and cover the skillet with a lid. Let simmer for between 10-13 minutes, or until the pasta is al dente. The time will vary based on the pasta you are using.⁣ 5. Uncover, add in vegan cheese, and mix until melted. Top taco pasta with optional toppings of choice. We love avocado, vegan sour cream, cherry tomatoes, and fresh cilantro. Serve immediately.⁣ ⁣ https://user_34.com/2020/05/creamy-one-pot-taco-pasta-30-minutes/ #onepot #feedfeed #pasta #feedfeedvegan #veganrecipe #user_34 #tacopasta

Meet LOUIE 🐶❤️ For those who may have missed it, our family recently grew by 1 🐶 Louie is a 4(ish) year old itty bitty chihuahua mix that we adopted from @agavedogsrescue about 2 weeks ago 💕 Although our relationship with him is still new, I already love him with all of my heart and so do Chris and Berry 😭⁣ ⁣ We don’t know too much about his background, but what we do know is that he was surrendered by his owner in Fresno this past February, and then Agave rescued him from that (kill) shelter in March. He is still shy and still unsure of us at times, but he has grown SO much since we adopted him and is such a love bug. We are so happy to have given him a new chance at life and our goal is to give him the best life ever because he deserves it 😭 ⁣ If you didn’t know, about 6.5 million companion animals enter U.S. shelters every year— about 3.3 million dogs and 3.2 million cats. Roughly half of the animals who enter shelters—many of them healthy, young, and adoptable—end up euthanized because there are simply too many animals and not enough worthy adoptive homes 🙁 A lot of these animals don’t get the chance at life because so many people choose to go through breeders/pet stores instead. Why is the life of a pure bred more valuable than a shelter dog? It’s not. When you choose to buy an animal, you also choose not to help the animals already in need and in turn, they will probably lose their life because of the lack of adoptions 💔⁣ ⁣ If you’re looking to bring a new friend into your life, PLEASE adopt instead of going through breeders, pet stores, etc. You will help break the cycle of pet overpopulation, you of course will SAVE a life and you will have a new bff — it’s a win win win in my book 📚 ⁣ ⁣ PS — my “RESCUE is my favorite breed” tee is from @rebl.vegan. They’re a small family owned vegan clothing brand owned by some of my friends in Colorado and you should definitely check them out! 🙏🏼⁣ ⁣ PPS— @theveganview did an episode with @maedayrescue and it’s very helpful if you want to learn more about why you should adopt! EASY VEGAN BANANA BREAD 🍌🍞 Fluffy, perfectly sweetened and easy to put together + it requires just 1 bowl and about an hour of your time 😍The full recipe is below and also on our blog https://user_34.com/2020/05/easy-vegan-banana-bread/ 🙏🏼⁣ ⁣ Ingredients⁣ Wet Ingredients⁣ * 1 1/3 cups (331g) mashed banana (about 3 large) + 1 more banana for on top⁣ * 1/2 cup (105g) melted coconut oil * (see notes)⁣ * 1 tbsp (15g) apple cider vinegar (or lemon juice)⁣ * 1/3 cup (78g) warm unsweetened almond milk (or plant-based milk of choice)⁣ * 1 tsp (1g) pure vanilla extract⁣ * 2 tbsp (16g) flaxseed meal⁣ (or chia seeds)⁣ Dry Ingredients⁣ * 2 cups (280g) unbleached all-purpose flour⁣ * 3/4–1 cup (120-160g) coconut sugar *see notes⁣ * 1 tsp (3g)  baking powder⁣ * 1 tsp (5g) baking soda⁣ * 1/2 tsp (4g) sea salt⁣ * 1/2 tsp (1g) cinnamon⁣ * 3/4 cup (85g) walnut halves, chopped⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. Line an 8×4-inch bread pan with parchment paper and preheat the oven to 350°F.⁣ 2. In a large bowl, add in all of the wet ingredients and mix until uniform. Set aside for 5 minutes so that the flaxseed meal can thicken.⁣ 3. Add in all of the dry ingredients except for the walnuts until uniform. Fold in the walnuts until combined.⁣ 4. Transfer the batter into the lined bread pan using a spatula, and then smooth out the top of the batter to make sure that it is equally distributed in the pan.⁣ 5. Take your last banana and slice it vertically. Place the banana halves, cut side up, onto the batter, gently pressing them in.⁣ 6. If you would like, you can lightly sprinkle the banana bread with additional coconut sugar before placing it into the oven. This allows for additional caramelization and makes the bananas even prettier when baked!⁣ 7. Bake for 55-60 minutes, or until golden brown and a toothpick runs clean.⁣ 8. So many of you have been recreating these and I’m so happy to see that you’re enjoying them 😍 The full recipe is below and also on our blog, link in my bio! ⁣ Ingredients⁣ * 1/4 cup maple syrup, or liquid sweetener of your choice⁣ * 1/4 cup nut or seed butter⁣ * 1 tsp vanilla extract⁣ * 1 tsp water⁣ * Optional: 1/4 tsp salt⁣ * 1 cup oat flour (see notes)⁣ * 1 1/2 tbsp vegan chocolate chips⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. In a large bowl, add the maple syrup, nut or seed butter, vanilla, water and optional salt. Mix until uniform.⁣ 2. Add the oat flour and mix until well combined, then using clean hands, “knead” the dough together to be sure it all mixes through. If the dough seems a bit too wet, you can add additional oat flour, 1/2 teaspoon at a time, until it reaches a cookie dough like consistency.⁣ 3. Add in the vegan chocolate chips and mix through with your hands.⁣ 4. Using a 1-tablespoon sized cookie scooper (or a regular tablespoon or even just with your hands), scoop out the dough and roll it into a ball. Continue until you have rolled out all of the dough– we formed 8.⁣ 5. Store in an airtight container for about 5 days, although these are best enjoyed the day of as they will dry out as they sit.⁣ ⁣ Notes⁣ - If you have rolled oats on hand, you can make your own oat flour. Place 1 cup in a high speed blender and blend until fine.⁣ - The nut or seed butter that is used will effect the flavor of the cookie dough. PORTOBELLO MUSHROOM “STEAKS” 😍🍄Tender, juicy, and melt-in-your-mouth goood 🔥 This is easy and gluten-free entree is perfect for date nights at home and it can be ready in less than an hour🙏🏼⁣ ⁣ The recipe is below and you can also find the saved step by step tutorial on my story highlights ❤️⁣ ⁣ Ingredients⁣ * 6 large portobello mushrooms⁣ * 1/3 cup balsamic vinegar⁣ * 1/4 cup tamari (or soy sauce if not gluten-free)⁣ * 2 tablespoons olive oil⁣ * 1 tablespoon vegan Worcestershire sauce⁣ * 1 teaspoon liquid smoke⁣ * 1/2–1 teaspoon black pepper (depending on how pepper-y you would like it)⁣ * 1 teaspoon garlic powder⁣ * 1 teaspoon onion powder⁣ * 2 sprigs fresh thyme, stems removed and finely chopped⁣ * 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. De-stem each portobello mushroom, leaving just the caps. Discard, compost or save the stems for homemade vegetable broth. Set mushroom caps aside.⁣ 2. In a large-sized wide and shallow dish, combine all of the ingredients except for the mushrooms. Whisk together until fully combined.⁣ 3. Add in the portobello mushroom caps to the marinade and flip them back and forth a few times for fully coat both sides. If needed, use a spoon to pour the marinade over the mushrooms. Allow the mushrooms to marinate for at least 15-30 minutes, the longer the better!⁣ 4. Once the mushrooms have marinated, heat a grill or a large skillet over medium-high heat. Once warmed, add the portobello mushrooms along with any remaining marinade* and cook on each side for 4-5 minutes, or until softened and a deep golden brown. Gently flip the mushrooms as they will be fragile!⁣ 5. Serve warm with sides of choice. This goes well with mashed potatoes or our fall rice pilaf!⁣ ⁣ Notes⁣ * We grilled asparagus to serve alongside our portobello mushroom steaks. Instead of pouring the remaining marinade in with the mushrooms, we saved it and used it to marinate the asparagus. *5 Tips For Staying Productive While Working From Home * ⁣ ⁣ Sometimes it can be tough to get into the zone when working remotely so I thought that these tips might be helpful, especially during this time! ❤️ ⁣ ⁣ 1. Create a Dedicated Workspace - Before we moved into our new home, the space we were living in did not have a dedicated workspace. This lead to us working in bed, in the kitchen, or living room, and it was far from ideal. Once we created a dedicated work space, our efficiency and focus shifted and we were able to become more productive with our work.⁣ ⁣ 2. Separate Yourself From Your Phone – This comes as no surprise, but our phones are easily the biggest distraction we have. We’ve been doing our best to distance ourselves as much as possible from our phones during working hours, and it has made an enormous difference in our productivity 🙏🏼 Here are a few different methods of reduce screen time: put your phone on airplane mode, turn off notifications, or leave your phone in another room.⁣ ⁣ 3. Take Breaks – We sometimes get so lost in what we are doing that we forget to take breaks. We have found that we are usually more creative and productive when we take small 10-15 minute breaks every two hours or so. These usually come in the form of getting more matcha/coffee, taking a walk outside, stretching, or playing with Berry.⁣ ⁣ 4. Be Aware of Your Posture – I wouldn’t be able to count how many times we started our workdays in bed or on the couch. While it may seem comfortable at first, after an hour or two, we find ourselves slouching, distracted, or even asleep. When we became more aware of our posture, we noticed such a difference in our focus and attention to the task at hand. To l help with posture, we also have a standing tabletop desk which is great to break up the monotony of sitting all day. (I realize that this photo is not the best example haha but we were just posing for the photo 😂)⁣ ⁣ 5. Keep it Minimal – When our office or workspace is clean and decluttered, it is so much easier to focus and be creative. Plus, a clean workspace helps us start the day with a clear mind and inspires us to get things done ✅ ⁣

VEGAN IRISH SODA BREAD! 🍞 An easy to make & foolproof vegan recipe that is ready in under an hour and requires just 10 simple ingredients! Plus the beauty of this bread is that no yeast is required 🙏🏼 Recipe is below and also linked in my bio! ⁣ ⁣ Ingredients⁣ * 1 1/2 cups unsweetened almond milk⁣ * 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar⁣ * 3 1/2–4 cups bread flour⁣ * 1 cup raisins⁣ * ½ cup brown sugar⁣ * 1 tablespoon flaxseed meal⁣ * 1 tablespoon cornstarch⁣ * 2 teaspoons baking soda⁣ * 1 teaspoon pink Himalayan salt⁣ * 1/4 cup vegan butter, melted⁣ * 1 tablespoon caraway seeds (optional)⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. Preheat the oven to 400°F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat. Set aside.⁣ 2. In a small bowl, combine the almond milk and apple cider vinegar. Stir to combine and set aside for 10 minutes. The almond milk will curdle and this will form a vegan buttermilk.⁣ 3. In a large bowl, mix together 3 1/2 cups of bread flour, raisins, brown sugar, flaxseed meal, cornstarch, baking soda, salt and caraway seeds. Mix together until uniform then create a well in the middle.⁣ 4. Once the buttermilk is ready, whisk the melted butter into it, and then pour this wet mixture into the well of the dry mixture. Stir from the center outward, incorporating the flour as you go. If the dough is too wet, as flour as needed. We added in 1/2 cup more flour.⁣ 5. Knead the dough in the bowl until a nice smooth ball of dough forms. Place the dough ball onto your prepared baking sheet. We added additional raisins on top for aesthetic purposes, but this is not necessary.⁣ 6. Use a sharp knife to cut an X into the top of the bread dough to help with air ventilation. Place into the oven and bake for 40 – 45 minutes, or until golden.⁣ 7. Remove from the oven and allow it to cool before slicing.⁣ 8. We like to serve ours toasted with a smear of strawberry jam or vegan butter.⁣ ⁣ #vegan #stpatricksday #irishsodabread https://user_34.com/2018/03/10-ingredient-vegan-irish-soda-bread/

5-MINUTE CREAMY LENTIL HUMMUS 😍 it’s easy to make and requires just 6 simple ingredients. Plus it’s so dang good you’ll be eating it by the spoonful 🤣🙏🏼 The recipe is below and also on our blog, linked in my bio or find it at https://user_34.com/2020/03/5-minute-creamy-lentil-hummus/ 😛⁣ ⁣ Ingredients⁣ * 1 head of garlic⁣ * 4 cups cooked lentils (we used brown) + more for garnish⁣ * 1/4-1/2 cup water⁣, or as needed to blend * 1/2 cup olive oil⁣ * 1/3 cup fresh lemon juice⁣ * 1/3 cup tahini⁣ * 1 to 1 1/4 teaspoon salt⁣ * Optional: 1/4 teaspoon ground cumin⁣ * Optional: Black pepper, to taste⁣ Top with:⁣ * Olive oil⁣ * Parsley⁣ * Cooked lentils⁣ * Smoked paprika⁣ * Black pepper⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. Preheat oven to 400°F. Remove the flaky outer skin off of the garlic head and then cut the top off of a head of garlic. Place it into a sheet of foil with a drizzle of olive oil. Wrap it up loosely and then place it into the oven (directly on the rack) for 1 hour and cool until easy to handle.⁣ 2. Place the cooked lentils into a high speed blender (or a food processor–see notes), along with the water, olive oil, lemon juice, tahini, salt, cumin, and black pepper. Unwrap the garlic head and squeeze the cooked garlic into the blender, being sure that no skins fall in. Blend until very smooth and fluffy.⁣ 3. Serve the hummus in wide bowls and top it with extra lentils along with any other toppings of choice. We used olive oil, lentils, paprika, parsley and black pepper.⁣ 4. Store the hummus in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 5 days.⁣ ⁣ Notes⁣ * A high speed blender is recommended for this, but a food processor works as well. Keep in mind that with a food processor, it may not be as smooth and you will need to blend it a bit longer.⁣ ⁣ #vegan #hummus #veganrecipe #5minuterecipe #user_34 #feedfeed #bestofvegan

HOMEMADE MARINARA SAUCE aka GRAVY 🔥❤️ I always thought that marinara sauce was going to be a time intensive recipe but I could not have been more wrong! This requires 30 minutes, just 10 simple ingredients to make, and it is so dang good. The full recipe is below and also on our blog, link in my bio or find it at https://user_34.com/2019/03/homemade-marinara-sauce/ Enjoy!⁣ ⁣ Ingredients⁣ * 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil*⁣ * 6 cloves garlic, minced⁣ * 1/2 large onion, finely chopped (1 1/4 cups)⁣ * 2 (28-ounce) cans whole peeled tomatoes* (see notes)⁣ * 1 dried bay leaf⁣ * 3 tablespoons tomato paste⁣ * 20 fresh basil leaves, roughly chopped* (see notes)⁣ * 2 teaspoons dried oregano⁣ * 1/4 teaspoon crushed red peppers⁣ * 1 teaspoon kosher salt⁣ * Black pepper, as desired⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. In a large pan over medium heat, add in the olive oil. Once warmed, add the onion and garlic. Sauté until the onions are translucent and the garlic is fragrant, about 4 minutes.⁣ 2. Add in the canned tomatoes (with juice), and gently break them apart using either a wooden spoon or a potato masher. Be careful as they may splatter.⁣ 3. Add in all of the remaining ingredients and mix until uniform. Simmer uncovered on low for 20 minutes, or the sauce reaches your desired consistency, stirring often. Remove from heat and remove the bay leaf. Taste and adjust seasonings as desired⁣ 4. Serve over your favorite pasta or even with some homemade mozzarella sticks.⁣ ⁣ (Notes in comment section) #vegan #user_34 #veganrecipe #homemademarinara #pasta #pastasauce #gravy #10ingredients

THAI GREEN CURRY 😍 So dang easy, flavor-packed + ready in 30 minutes! The full recipe is down below and also on our a blog, linked in my bio or found here https://user_34.com/2019/05/thai-green-curry/. I’m am craving this right now, @consciouschris make it for me? 😝⁣ ⁣ Ingredients⁣ * 1/2 block (6 oz.) firm tofu, pressed and diced⁣ * Avocado oil (or cooking oil of choice)⁣ * 1/2 cup finely diced white onion⁣ * 1 tablespoon finely minced fresh ginger⁣ * 3 cloves garlic, minced⁣ * 3 tablespoons Thai green curry paste*⁣ (see notes) * 1 can (14 oz.) full fat coconut milk⁣ * 1 cup water⁣ * 1 heaping teaspoon coconut sugar (or brown sugar)⁣ * 1/2 cup broccoli⁣ * 1/2 cup sliced carrots⁣ * 1 small Yukon gold potato, diced (about 1/2 cup)⁣ * 1/2 red bell pepper, thinly sliced (about 1/2 cup)⁣ * 1/3 cup cilantro, finely chopped⁣ * Fresh lime, as desired (optional)⁣ * Salt, to taste⁣ * 2 cups brown rice, to serve⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. If your tofu is not already pressed, be sure to press it to remove excess moisture. Once it is pressed, heat a medium nonstick pan over medium heat and add in a drizzle of oil. Dice the tofu and add it to the pan. Sprinkle the tofu with salt and pan fry for about 10 minutes, flipping often, until the tofu is golden brown. Remove and set aside.⁣ 2. In the same pot, add in about 2 tablespoons of water (or another drizzle of oil) along with the onions, ginger and garlic. Sauté for about 3 minutes, stirring often, until the onions are translucent and the garlic is fragrant. Be sure to add more water (2 tablespoons at a time) as needed to prevent burning.⁣ 3. Add in the sliced bell peppers, carrots and potatoes, and cook for 3 minutes more.⁣ 4. Add in the coconut milk, water, coconut sugar, and curry paste. Mix through and bring the pot to a simmer over medium heat. Lower the heat to medium-low and simmer uncovered for 8-10 minutes, or until the potatoes are fork-tender.⁣ (CONTINUED IN COMMENTS)⁣ ⁣ #vegan #user_34 #veganrecipes #thaigreencurry #vegancurry

We need to talk...⁣ ⁣ I’ve had this on my mind for the last few days but I first had to take some time to cool off before speaking without my emotions getting involved 🙏🏼⁣ ⁣ Social media can be a positive place that motivates and inspires us to make changes in our lives for the better. At the same time however, it can become a very dark, hateful and uncomfortable space. People feel like they can say what ever they want without consequence or accountability. I do support everyone being able to have their own opinions, but what I do not support is bringing others down because they don’t think/live/act how YOU want them to. ⁣ ⁣ It’s frustrating how the anonymity of the internet has made people so much more brave behind their screens, in a negative way.⁣ ⁣ People think that they can say anything that they want without any consequence because they don’t actually know the person they are speaking to. Guess what? There are consequences and BIG ones. Your comments will affect the person you are directing them to-- you have no idea what the person has or is going through, and you can trigger them/push them over the edge. ⁣ ⁣ When I was in my late teens/early twenties, I dealt with depression, an eating disorder and just overall low self-esteem. I have worked my ass off to get to where I’m at today with therapy, exercise and working on remaining positive (which I struggle with daily), but sometimes one comment can just shoot me down and make me feel like the effort wasn’t worth it. I’m not here to complain and I know that some people may say to “grow a thicker skin” and deal with it because it’s a “part of the job”, but I don’t agree. I think that online bullying and harassment is what needs to be dealt with, and it needs to stop.⁣ ⁣ ** If you see something like this happening, speak up-- respond to the negative comment/video and let them know that bullying/harassment is not cool and not right. The more we all work together to address this issue, the more progress we will make it getting it to STOP. ** ⁣ End rant haha thank you for taking the time to read! ❤️🙃 #user_34 #onlinebullying

BROCCOLI RABE & SAUSAGE PASTA 😍 When we were planning our Valentine’s Day entree recipe, we knew it had to be this dish because nothing says I Love You like a big bowl of pasta 🌚🍝 plus broccoli rabe and vegan sausage make for the perfect pasta pairing. ⁣ ⁣ Shoutout to Chris’ parents for sharing their recipe with us. Recipe is below and on our blog https://user_34.com/2020/02/broccoli-rabe-sausage-pasta/ linked in my bio, enjoy! ⁣⁣⁣⁣ ⁣⁣⁣⁣ Ingredients⁣⁣⁣⁣ * 1 bunch of broccoli rabe⁣⁣⁣⁣ * 16 oz. pasta of choice (GF as needed)⁣⁣⁣⁣ * 3 vegan sausages, slices into rounds (we used @BeyondMeat Hot Italian)⁣⁣⁣⁣ * 4 cloves of garlic, minced⁣⁣⁣⁣ * 1 shallot, sliced thin⁣⁣⁣⁣ * 7 sundried tomatoes in oil, roughly chopped⁣⁣⁣⁣ * 1/4 tsp red pepper flakes, or to taste⁣⁣⁣⁣ * Salt and pepper, to taste⁣⁣⁣⁣ * 1/4 cup minced fresh parsley⁣⁣⁣⁣ * Optional: 1/4 cup shredded Parmesan cheese (we used @violife)⁣⁣⁣⁣ ⁣⁣⁣⁣ Instructions⁣⁣⁣⁣ 1. Prepare the broccoli rabe by removing the light-colored leaves as well as the bottom portion of the stems (about 1-inch off of the bottom).⁣⁣⁣⁣ 2. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Prepare an ice bath in a large bowl.⁣⁣⁣⁣ 3. Add a pinch of salt to the boiling water and then blanch broccoli rabe for about 1 minute. Drain the broccoli rabe and immediately add it to the ice bath for 1 minute. Drain and transfer the broccoli rabe to a cutting board. Cut the stems into bit sized pieces and set aside.⁣⁣⁣⁣ 4. Bring another medium pot of water to boil and prepare pasta according to package instructions. Drain and do not rinse.⁣⁣⁣⁣ 5. In a separate pan, add in  the vegan sausages and cook until caramelized and browned. Remove the sausage from the pan and set aside. In the same pan in the leftover oil from the sausage, add in the garlic and shallots and sauté until fragrant and translucent. Add in the red pepper flakes snd cook for about 1 minute more, stirring often.⁣⁣⁣⁣ 6. Add in the broccoli rabe, sun-dried tomatoes, vegan sausage and cooked pasta. Mix until fully combined. Season with salt and pepper to taste.⁣⁣⁣⁣ (CONTINUED IN COMMENTS)⁣⁣⁣ ⁣⁣⁣ #vegan #veganitalian #italianfood #user_34 #valentinesday #feedfeedvegan #pasta

EASY VEGAN CHEESE FONDUE 😍 Tag your friends and make this recipe ASAP! It requires one pot and just about 10 minutes of your time 🙏🏼 It’s perfect for date night, dinner parties and even game day! ⁣ ⁣ Recipe is below and also on our blog via the link in my bio or at https://user_34.com/2020/02/easy-vegan-cheese-fondue/ 🔥⁣⁣⁣ ⁣⁣⁣ Ingredients⁣⁣⁣ Fondue⁣⁣⁣ * 4 cloves garlic, finely minced⁣⁣⁣ * 2 tbsp vegan butter (or cooking oil of choice)⁣⁣⁣ * 2 tbsp all-purpose flour (gluten-free if needed)⁣⁣⁣ * 8 oz. lager-style beer, at room temperature * (see notes)⁣⁣⁣ * 8 oz. vegetable broth⁣⁣⁣ * 16 oz. shredded vegan cheese (we used half cheddar and half mozzarella)⁣⁣⁣ * 1/2 to 1 tbsp grainy mustard, to taste⁣⁣⁣ * Salt and pepper, as desired⁣⁣⁣ Dippers of choice, such as⁣⁣⁣ * Crackers⁣⁣⁣ * Chips⁣⁣⁣ * Cubed bread — we like to used sourdough or french bread⁣⁣⁣ * Carrots, sliced⁣⁣⁣ * Celery, cut into small pieces⁣⁣⁣ * Steamed broccoli⁣⁣⁣ * Steamed cauliflower⁣⁣⁣ * Granny Smith apples, cubed⁣⁣⁣ * Roasted cubed potatoes⁣⁣⁣ * Cherry tomatoes⁣⁣⁣ ⁣⁣⁣ Instructions⁣⁣⁣ 1. In a medium spot over medium heat, add in the vegan butter. Once melted, add in the garlic and cook for 1 minute, or until fragrant.⁣⁣⁣ 2. Add in the flour and mix it through until everything is evenly coated. Cook for about 1 minute.⁣⁣⁣ 3. Pour in the vegan beer, vegetable broth and mustard and mix until uniform. Bring the mixture to a boil.⁣⁣⁣ 4. Once simmering, slowly being to add the cheese a little at a time, stirring well between each addition to ensure a smooth fondue. Adjust the seasonings to taste and season with salt and pepper as desired.⁣⁣⁣ 5. If you have a fondue pot, transfer it to the pot and light it to keep the sauce warm. Serve with dippers of choice and enjoy!⁣⁣⁣ ⁣⁣⁣ (NOTES IN COMMENTS)⁣⁣ #vegan #valentinesday #cheesefondue #10minuterecipe #vegancheese #veganrecipe

We finally finished our home office! 😍 After living in this house for almost 2 years, we thought that it was finally time to create a proper workspace for ourselves since we both work from home. It took a lot of time, effort and frustration (lol) to get this together but it’s done and I couldn’t be happier!! ⁣🎉⁣⁣⁣ ⁣⁣⁣⁣ Our #1 tip for working from home is to create a *dedicated* workspace for yourself that you love. It doesn’t have to be anything fancy and of course you don’t need to redo a whole room like we did, but if you can, have a space that is solely for work and nothing else. The space we were living in prior to this one did not have a dedicated workspace and that lead to us working in the bedroom, kitchen, living room, etc. and it was far from ideal. Once we moved we wanted to create a work space that was not only motivating, but also inspiring. Since we both work from home, we wanted the space to be roomy enough for the two of us so we also made sure to get a large desk that we could both share but still have personal space on. ⁣⁣⁣ ⁣⁣ Shoutout to @hellomedley for this beautiful bamboo table! FROZEN CHOCOLATE COVERED BANANAS WITH PEANUT BUTTER 😍 a match made in heaven. Just 3-ingredients, the perfect little bites to satisfy your sweet tooth AND easy to make! ⁣ ⁣ The recipe below and also on our blog at https://user_34.com/2019/02/chocolate-bananas-peanut-butter/ Enjoy!⁣⁣ ⁣⁣ Ingredients⁣⁣ * 3 medium to large bananas, ripe but still firm*⁣⁣ * 1/4 cup creamy peanut butter* (see notes)⁣⁣ * 1 cup (8 oz.) vegan chocolate chips⁣⁣ ⁣⁣ Instructions⁣⁣ 1. Line a small baking sheet or plate with parchment paper and set aside.⁣⁣ 2. Peel the bananas and cut them into 1/4-inch slices. Arrange half of the slices on the lined baking sheet and set the rest aside.⁣⁣ 3. Using a small spoon or butter knife, spread about 1/4-1/2 teaspoon of peanut butter onto the bananas slices on the baking sheet. Top each half with the remaining banana slices to form “sandwiches”. Set the baking sheet into the freezer for 2 hours to set.⁣⁣ 4. Prepare the chocolate. Place chocolate chips into a microwave safe bowl and microwave them for 30 seconds and then stir. Continue microwaving the chocolate in 30-second intervals, mixing in between each, until they are fully melted.⁣⁣ 5. Remove baking sheet from the freezer. Using two forks, quickly coat each “sandwich” banana sandwich in the melted chocolate, being sure to shake off any excess chocolate, and place it back onto the baking sheet. The chocolate may start to harden as you coat the bananas. This is normal and happens at the end of the batch as the temperature of the bananas encourages the chocolate to set. Just remelt the chocolate.⁣⁣ 6. Return the baking sheet to the freezer to set for 1 hour or until solid. After frozen, transfer the bites to an airtight freezer-safe container for up to 1 month.⁣⁣ ⁣⁣ Notes⁣⁣ * Make sure that the bananas are ripe, but still firm. If the bananas are too ripe, they will be soft and hard to work with.⁣⁣ * Another thick and creamy nut OR seed butter will work in place of peanut butter. The key is to use a one that is not runny. Sunflower, cashew and almond butter works great.⁣⁣ * Allow these to thaw for a few minutes before eating if your teeth are sensitive to cold. #vegan #user_34

3-INGREDIENT CHOCOLATE PEANUT BUTTER FUDGE 🍫 Creamy, smoooth, and so easy to make! I’ll be posting some of my favorite chocolate recipes from the blog so stay tuned for more 😛 You can find this recipe below and on our blog https://user_34.com/2019/02/chocolate-peanut-butter-fudge/ 🖤 ⁣ ⁣ Ingredients⁣ * 2 cups vegan chocolate chips of choice (we used semi-sweet)⁣ * 1 cup no-stir peanut butter (or any smooth and thick nut or seed butter; see notes)*⁣ * 1 tsp vanilla extract⁣ * Maldon salt, to garnish (optional)⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. Line a medium dish with parchment paper. Set aside.⁣ 2. To a food processor, add the peanut butter and the vanilla extract.⁣ 3. Place the chocolate chips in a medium microwave-safe bowl. Microwave the chocolate in 30-second increments, mixing after each increment, until it is completely melted. Add the melted chocolate into the food processor and process until smooth. Alternatively you can melt the chocolate in a double boiler in the stove.⁣ 4. Using a spatula, transfer the fudge from the food processor to the lined dish, being sure to smooth out the top. Place into the refrigerator and allow the fudge to set for 1 hour, or until solidified.⁣ 5. Remove from the refrigerator. Loosen up the sides of the fudge using a butter knife and pop it out of the baking dish. Transfer to a cutting board and using a slightly wet sharp knife, cut into small squares (we cut 24).⁣ 6. Top the fudge with salt (optional) and dig in.⁣ 7. Transfer the fudge into an airtight container and store it in the refrigerator for up to 3 weeks (see notes)*.⁣ ⁣ Notes⁣ * We used Trader Joe’s Creamy no-stir peanut butter. ⁣ * If you are allergic to peanuts or prefer not to use them, another thick and creamy nut OR seed butter will work in its place. Just make sure that the nut or seed butter is not runny. to ensure that the fudge has the perfect consistency and sets properly. Sunflower, cashew and almond butter all work great.⁣ * You can also store in an airtight container in the freezer for about 3 months, just be sure to thaw for about 15 minutes before consuming.⁣

ONE POT VEGETABLE NOODLE SOUP 😍 hearty, loaded with veggies, full of flavor, and so easy to make! It’s perfect for cold winter days and can be made in a large batch to enjoy throughout the week 🌚 Recipe is below and also linked in my bio, enjoy! ✨⁣⁣ ⁣⁣ Ingredients⁣⁣⁣ * 1/2 medium onion, finely diced⁣⁣⁣ * 3 garlic cloves, finely minced⁣⁣⁣ * 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes⁣⁣⁣ * 1 1/2 lbs. russet or yukon gold potato, diced⁣⁣⁣ * 3 medium carrots, sliced into rounds⁣⁣⁣ * 2 ribs celery, chopped⁣⁣⁣ * 1 (15 oz.) can cooked brown lentils, drained and rinsed⁣⁣⁣ * 3 sprigs of fresh thyme⁣⁣⁣ * 2 bay leaves⁣⁣⁣ * 8 oz. rotini pasta⁣⁣⁣ * 10 cups vegetable broth⁣⁣⁣ * 5 oz. kale, roughly chopped⁣⁣⁣ * Salt and pepper, to taste⁣⁣⁣ ⁣⁣⁣ Instructions⁣⁣⁣ 1. Enjoy ✨ ⁣ Ingredients⁣ * 6 oz. dried noodles of choice (or gluten-free noodles of choice; see notes in comments)⁣ * 1 tablespoon cooking oil of choice⁣ * 3 cloves garlic, finely minced⁣ * 2 tablespoons green onions sliced⁣ * 1 tablespoon freshly grated ginger⁣ * 1/3 cup shredded red cabbage⁣ * 4 oz. crimini mushrooms, sliced⁣ * 1 medium carrot, thinly sliced⁣ * 1 medium red pepper, thinly sliced⁣ * 2 large handfuls fresh baby spinach⁣ * 1/2 cup snow peas⁣ * 1 large lime⁣ Stir Fry Sauce:⁣ * 1/3 cup tamari (or low sodium soy sauce if not gluten-free)⁣ * 1/4 water⁣ * 3 tablespoon pure maple syrup⁣ * 1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil⁣ * 1 tablespoon rice vinegar ⁣ * 2 teaspoons cornstarch⁣ * Optional: 1/2 to 1 teaspoon sriracha⁣ Garnish with⁣ * Cilantro, finely chopped⁣ * Toasted sesame seeds⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. In a small bowl, whisk together all of the ingredients for the stir fry sauce until uniform. Set aside.⁣ 2. Prepare the noodles according to the package directions. Once the noodles are cooked, drain them, rinse under cold water, add them back into the cooking pot and toss them with about 1 teaspoon of sesame oil to prevent sticking.⁣ 3. In the meantime, set a a large wok over medium heat. Add in the cooking oil along with the garlic, green onions and ginger. Sauté, stirring often, for 3 minutes or until fragrant.⁣ 4. Next add in the cabbage, mushrooms, carrots, and bell pepper. Cook for an additional 4 minutes. ⁣ 5. Once the vegetables have cooked, add in the spinach, snow peas, stir fry sauce and noodles. Mix until everything is well combined.⁣ 6. Allow everything to cook for 3-4 minutes more, stirring often, or until the sauce thickens.⁣ 7. Remove the wok from heat and toss the stir fry with the juice of 1/2 to 1 lime, or to taste.  Serve with a garnish of cilantro and toasted sesame seeds. Enjoy!⁣ ⁣ Notes in comments below!  https://user_34.com/2020/01/easy-vegetable-stir-fry/ #vegan #veganrecipes #stirfry #mealprep #veganuary

Who wants some EASY 3-INGREDIENT CHOCOLATE MOUSSE? 😍 Decadent, creamy, dairy-free and SO dang good! Recipe is below and also can be found at https://user_34.com/2019/02/easy-chocolate-mousse/. Enjoy 🥰 ⁣ Chocolate Mousse⁣ * 1 cup vegan dark chocolate chips⁣ * 1 1/2 cups full-fat coconut milk* (see notes)⁣ * 1 heaping cup pitted Medjool dates⁣ * 1 teaspoon vanilla extract (optional)⁣ Toppings (optional)⁣ * Vegan whipped cream⁣ * Raspberries, blueberries, strawberries, etc.⁣ * Shaved or chopped dark chocolate⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. Place the chocolate chips in a medium microwave-safe bowl. Microwave the chocolate in 15-second increments, mixing after each increment, until it is completely melted. It took about 90 seconds for our chocolate to melt.⁣ 2. Add the melted chocolate into a high-speed blender along with the remaining ingredients and blend until very smooth. Taste and add more dates to sweeten it up as needed.⁣ 3. Transfer the mixture into a sealable container, being sure to try and again every last bit in the blender. Cover the container and place the mixture into the refrigerator for about 2-3 hours to set, or until thick and cooled.⁣ 4. Remove the mousse from the refrigerator. Using a whisk or a spatula, vigorously mix the mousse to fluff it up.⁣ 5. Transfer the mousse into serving cups and add optional toppings of your choice. Enjoy!⁣ ⁣ Notes⁣ * We prefer full-fat coconut milk for this recipe as it yields the best results since it is higher in fat than other plant-based milks, but you can definitely use any other plant-based milk of your choice in this.⁣ * We have not tested this recipe with any other variety of dates but from our experience with other recipes, deglet noor will work in this, it will just alter the flavor slightly.⁣ #vegan #user_34 #vegandessert #veganrecipe #veganuary

Calling all potato lovers 🥔 these crispy garlic and herb smashed potatoes are about to change your life. Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, these smashed potatoes are garlicky and down-right delicious. They require just 7 simple ingredients and will be ready in less than an hour! Recipe is below, on our blog and also in my highlights! Enjoy! 😍 ⁣ Ingredients⁣ * 2 lb. small yukon gold potatoes⁣ * 3 tbsp olive oil, avocado oil or melted vegan butter⁣ * 5 cloves garlic, finely minced⁣ * 1/2 tbsp fresh rosemary, finely minced⁣ * 1/2 tbsp fresh thyme leaves, finely minced⁣ * 1 tbsp + 1/2 tsp salt (or as desired)⁣ * 1/4 tsp black pepper (or as desired)⁣ * Optional: 2-3 tbsp vegan parmesan cheese⁣, to top ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. Preheat oven to 450°F and lightly grease a baking sheet OR line it with parchment paper/a silicone mat.⁣ 2. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Once boiling, add in 1 tablespoon of salt along with all of the potatoes and cook on a simmer for about 15-30 minutes, or until tender and easily pierced with a fork. Cooking time will vary depending on the size of the potatoes, so we recommend checking on them every 10 minutes by piercing the largest potato with the tip of a sharp knife. You will know when it’s ready when the knife slides in easily with no resistance.⁣ 3. Grab a small bowl and mix together the oil/butter, garlic, rosemary, thyme, the remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt, and pepper until uniform. Set aside.⁣ 4. Once the potatoes are cooked, drain them and spread them evenly on the baking sheet. Using a drinking up, measuring cup, or potato masher, press down on the potatoes to “smash” them until they are about 1/2-inch thick (thinner potatoes = crispier result). Press down slowly so that they don’t break! Evenly distribute oil mixture onto the potatoes, trying your best to cover the whole surface of each.⁣ 5. Place the potatoes in the oven for 20 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy.⁣ 6. Remove the potatoes from the oven and top them with vegan parmesan cheese as desired. ⁣ #vegan #user_34 #veganrecipe #feedfeed #feedfeedvegan #bestofvegan https://user_34.com/2019/07/crispy-garlic-smashed-potatoes/

DATE-SWEETENED BAKLAVA 😍⁣⁣ Sweet, flaky, and melt in your mouth good. Need I say more? Recipe below and on the blog, linked in my bio, enjoy!⁣⁣ ⁣⁣ Ingredients⁣⁣ Filling⁣⁣ * 1 1/2 cups (11.87oz) pitted medjool dates, finely chopped*⁣⁣ * 1 cup (5.4 oz) almonds⁣⁣ * 1 cup (4 oz) walnuts⁣⁣ * 1 cup (4.12 oz) pistachios⁣⁣ * 1/2 tbsp orange zest⁣⁣ * 1/2 tbsp cinnamon⁣⁣ * 1/4 tsp salt⁣⁣ * 1 stick vegan butter, melted⁣⁣ * 32 sheets phyllo (filo) dough, defrosted⁣⁣ Syrup⁣⁣ * 1/2 cup date syrup ⁣⁣ * 1/2 cup filtered water⁣⁣ * 1/2 tbsp lemon juice, adjust to taste⁣⁣ * 1/2 tsp cinnamon⁣⁣ * 1/4 tsp salt⁣⁣ * 1/4 tsp ground cardamom (optional)⁣⁣ * 1 tsp vanilla extract⁣⁣ Topping⁣⁣ * 2 tbsp shelled unsalted pistachios, finely chopped or crushed⁣⁣ ⁣⁣ Instructions⁣⁣ 1. In a food processor, add in the dates, almonds, walnuts, pistachios, orange zest, cinnamon, and salt. Pulse until the mixture is just roughly chopped. You do not want them to be fine as they will not have the right consistency for the baklava. Set aside.⁣⁣ 2. Grab your phyllo dough and a medium baking dish (ours was 10×8″).⁣⁣ 3. Placed it on a clean work surface and then put a baking dish on top. Be sure not to press down so hard so you don’t compact the phyllo. Using a sharp knife, trim the phyllo to the size of the pan. It is better to cut bigger than smaller here so if it is not perfect, don’t worry because once it bakes you won’t be able to tell. This step is optional, you can also just fold in the edges as you layer the baklava. This will just yield the best results.⁣⁣ 4. Cover the phyllo with a slightly damp tea towel to keep it from drying out. Set aside.⁣⁣ 5. Brush the bottom and sides of the baking dish with a thin layer of melted vegan butter. Lay on two sheets of the phyllo and then gently drizzle it with vegan butter. We did not brush on the vegan butter as it may rip the phyllo. Repeat the layering, buttering ever 2 sheets of phyllo, until you have a base of 8 sheets of phyllo.⁣⁣ ⁣ (Continued in comments) ⁣ ⁣ #vegan #user_34 #datesweetened #feedfeed #feedfeedvegan #feedfeedbaking https://user_34.com/2018/10/date-sweetened-baklava/

VEGAN POZOLE ROJO with Mushrooms and Red Beans (Mexican Hominy Stew) 😋 A hearty and satisfying soup jam-packed with flavor and the perfect kick of spice. This traditional Mexican soup with hominy and peppers is taken to a whole new level with the addition of mushrooms and red beans. It is vegan, oil-free and the ultimate comfort food! Recipe is below and also on the blog, linked in my bio. Enjoy!⁣ 😘 ⁣ Ingredients⁣ Soup⁣ * 5 cups water (for soaking the peppers)⁣ * 3 guajillo chiles⁣ * 2 ancho chiles⁣ * 2 quarts vegetable broth⁣ * 1/2 cup finely diced white onion⁣ * 6 cloves garlic, finely minced⁣ * 16 oz shiitake and oyster mushrooms, sliced (we used ½ of each but feel free to use any combo or mushroom type)⁣ * 1 (25 oz.) can hominy⁣ * 1 (15.25 oz.) can red kidney beans⁣ * 3 tbsp tomato paste⁣ * 2 tsp dried oregano⁣ * 1 tsp cumin⁣ * 2 bay leaves⁣ * Salt, as needed⁣ Serve with⁣ * Thinly sliced radish⁣ * Sliced limes⁣ * Shredded cabbage⁣ * Tortilla chips or strips⁣ * Cilantro, roughly chopped⁣ * Diced red onion⁣ * Diced avocado⁣ * Vegan cheese (we use homemade parmesan)⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. Bring 5 cups of water to a boil. In the meantime, cut the tops off of the peppers and slit them down the sides. Remove and discard the seeds. Transfer the pepper to a large heat-safe bowl and pour the boiling water over the peppers. Soak for 30 minutes.⁣ 2. In the meantime, prepare the remaining ingredients. In a large pot, add in a 2 tablespoons of vegetable broth. Once warmed, add in onions and garlic and saute for 2-3 minutes, or until the onions are translucent and the garlic is fragrant.⁣ 3. Add in the sliced mushrooms and cook for 4-5 minutes more, or until cooked down and softened. You may need to add 2-3 additional tablespoons of vegetable broth as needed to prevent burning.⁣ 4. Once the mushrooms have cooked down, add in the oregano, cumin, tomato paste, 2 bay leaves, hominy, and beans. Mix until uniform. Add in the remaining vegetable broth and mix through.⁣ (Continued in comments)  #user_34 #vegan #veganrecipes #veganmexican #pozole #pozolerojo https://user_34.com/2018/12/pozole-rojo/

PECAN, CRANBERRY & ORANGE SHORTBREAD COOKIES 😍 #ad @americanpecan challenged me to create a holiday recipe that showcases the versatile, nutrient dense and power-packed protein nut, the PECAN, and this is what I came up with! Did you know that they are the only major tree nut native to North America and are now harvested in over a dozen Southern states?— What better way to celebrate the holidays than with some cookies? And not just any cookies, these are shortbread cookies with chunks of naturally sweet & buttery pecans, tart and chewy cranberry pieces PLUS a fresh kick of zested orange. It doesn’t get any better than that! The recipe is below :) Enjoy!⁣ ⁣ Cookies⁣ * 1 stick (1/2 cup) vegan butter, softened⁣ * 1/4 cup (51g) light brown sugar⁣ * 1/8 cup (31g) granulated sugar⁣ * 1 teaspoon (4g) vanilla extract⁣ * 1/2 teaspoon (3.5g) salt⁣ * 1/2 cup (3 ounces or 60g) fresh pecan pieces⁣ * 1/2 cup (68g) dried cranberries⁣ * Zest of 1 orange (4g or about 1/2 tbsp)⁣ * 1 1/4 cups (150g) all purpose flour⁣ ⁣ Icing⁣ * 1/2 cup powdered  sugar⁣ * 1/2 tablespoon orange juice⁣ * 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract⁣ * Water or almond milk, as needed to thin⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. Toast the pecans: Preheat oven to 350°F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat. In the bowl of a standing mixer with the paddle attachment or in a large mixing bowl with a hand mixer, beat together the vegan butter and sugars until creamy. Add the vanilla and continue beating.⁣ 3. Next, add in all of the cranberries and flour and slowly beat it in until combined. In a large bowl combine the flour, yeast, salt, olives, rosemary and garlic until uniform. Form a well in the middle and add in the water. Stir until well incorporated and a shaggy dough forms. You’ll know it’s ready when it has expanded and has bubbles all over the surface. ⁣ 3. Generously flour a work surface (we worked on parchment paper) and pour the dough out onto it. Once it has set, shape dough into a ball, sprinkling over additional flour as needed to prevent sticking. Cover the dough with a damp towel and allow it to rise for about 2 hours. ⁣ 5. 30 minutes before the 2 hour mark, preheat your oven to 450F and place a 6 quart dutch oven (or heavy covered pot) inside. VEGAN SUGAR COOKIES 😍 I had so much fun putting these cookie together for the blog and I really hope you can enjoy them with your families over the holidays 🖤 The recipe is below and also on our blog linked in my bio, enjoy ✨⁣ ⁣ Ingredients⁣⁣ Sugar Cookies⁣⁣ * 1 flax egg (1 tbsp flaxseed meal + 3 tbsp water)⁣⁣ * 3/4 cup (162g) granulated sugar⁣⁣ * 1 stick (1/2 cup) vegan butter, softened⁣⁣ * 1 tsp pure vanilla extract⁣⁣ * 1/4 tsp almond extract⁣⁣ * 2 1/4 (270g) cups all-purpose flour⁣⁣ * 1 tsp (4g) baking powder⁣⁣ * 1/4 (1.5g) tsp salt⁣⁣ Icing⁣⁣ * 1 cup organic powdered sugar⁣⁣ * 1/4 tsp pure vanilla extract⁣⁣ * 1 1/2 to 2 tbsp unsweetened almond milk⁣⁣ ⁣⁣ ⁣⁣ Instructions⁣⁣ 1. Remove the butter from the refrigerator and allow it to rest at room temperature for at least 30 minutes before starting.⁣⁣ 2. Prepare the flax egg by mixing together the flaxseed meal and water in a small bowl and setting it aside for 15 minutes to thicken.⁣⁣ 3. In a large bowl, add in the flour, baking powder and salt.  Mix everything together until uniform and then set aside.⁣⁣ 4. In another large bowl, add in the softened vegan butter, and granulated sugar. Using a hand mixer or standing mixer, cream together until nice and fluffy. Add in the prepared flax egg, vanilla and almond extracts and mix until combined. CINNAMON TWIST CHRISTMAS COOKIES 🌲 A simple 8-ingredient vegan cookie that is definitely going to be one of your new holiday favorites. Sweet, nutty and melt-in-your-mouth gooood. Oh and don’t forget to leave some out for Santa 😂⁣ Recipe is below and linked in my bio, enjoy ✨ ⁣ Ingredients⁣ * 1 cup whole walnuts⁣ * 3/4 cups organic cane sugar⁣ * 3/4 cups organic brown sugar⁣ * 1/2 tbsp ground cinnamon⁣ * 4 oz. vegan cream cheese⁣ * 4 oz. vegan butter⁣ * 1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour + more for rolling⁣ * 2 tbsp unsweetened almond milk⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. Preheat the oven to 325°F, and line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.⁣ 2. In a food processor, pulse the walnuts until they are finely ground. Transfer the walnuts to a large bowl along with the cane sugar and cinnamon. Set aside.⁣ 3. In a large mixing bowl, cream the vegan cream cheese and butter together until fluffy. Gradually add the all-purpose flour until it forms a smooth dough. If the dough is too soft, add a little more flour. Place the bowl in the refrigerator for 15 minutes.⁣ 4. Flour a clean work surface. Once the dough has chilled, roll it out into about a 15×12″ rectangle, about 1/2 inch thick. Using a brush, lightly coat the dough with the almond milk. NO BAKE PUMPKIN CHAI CHEESECAKE 😍 An easy, vegan and gluten-free dessert that everyone, vegan or not, is going to LOVE. A creamy cashew and coconut filling that is perfectly spiced and poured over a nutty date crust 🔥 This cheesecake is full of flavor and perfect for the holidays! Recipe is below and linked in my bio ✨⁣ ⁣ Ingredients⁣ Crust⁣ * 1 cup packed deglet noor or medjool dates (pitted before measuring), roughly chopped⁣ * 1 cup raw walnuts*⁣ * 1/2 cup pumpkin seeds (or additional 1/2 cup walnuts)⁣ * 1 tbsp refined coconut oil, melted*⁣ * 1/4 tsp salt⁣ Filling⁣ * 2 cups raw cashews, soaked and strained*⁣ * 1/2 cup canned full-fat coconut milk*⁣ * 1/2 cup pure maple syrup⁣ * 1/3 cup + 1 tbsp pumpkin puree⁣ * ¼ cup refined coconut oil, melted*⁣ * 3 tbsp fresh lemon juice⁣ * 1 tsp pure vanilla extract⁣ * 1/2 tsp ground cardamom⁣ * 1/2 tsp cinnamon⁣ * 1/2 tsp turmeric⁣ * 1/4 tsp salt⁣ * 1/8 tsp cloves⁣ * 1/8 tsp nutmeg⁣ * Pinch of black pepper*⁣ Toppings of choice, such as⁣ * Vegan whipped cream⁣ * Pumpkin seeds⁣ * Date Syrup⁣ * Cinnamon ⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. Prepare a large springform pan. We lined the bottom of ours with parchment paper and then sprayed the sides with coconut oil to ensure that the cheesecake did not stick.⁣ 2. Add the Deglet Noor dates to a food processor and run until broken down into small pieces. Add in the remaining ingredients and process until a dough forms. VEGAN PORTOBELLO MUSHROOM STEAKS! 🍄 Tender, juicy, and melt-in-your-mouth gooooood. It’s is an easy vegan and gluten-free entree perfect for holiday dinners or date nights at home and will be ready in less than an hour ✨ Recipe is below and also linked in my bio, enjoy 🖤 ⁣ Ingredients⁣ * 6 large portobello mushrooms⁣ * 1/3 cup balsamic vinegar⁣ * 1/4 cup tamari (or soy sauce if not gluten-free)⁣ * 2 tablespoons olive oil⁣ * 1 tablespoon vegan Worcestershire sauce (We used Edward & Son’s)⁣ * 1 teaspoon liquid smoke⁣ * 1/2–1 teaspoon black pepper (depending on how pepper-y you would like it)⁣ * 1 teaspoon garlic powder⁣ * 1 teaspoon onion powder⁣ * 2 sprigs fresh thyme, stems removed and finely chopped⁣ * 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. De-stem each portobello mushroom, leaving just the caps. Discard, compost or save the stems for homemade vegetable broth. Set mushroom caps aside.⁣ 2. In a large-sized wide and shallow dish, combine all of the ingredients except for the mushrooms. Whisk together until fully combined.⁣ 3. Add in the portobello mushroom caps to the marinade and flip them back and forth a few times for fully coat both sides. If needed, use a spoon to pour the marinade over the mushrooms. Allow the mushrooms to marinate for at least 15-30 minutes, the longer the better!⁣ 4. Once the mushrooms have marinated, heat a grill or a large skillet over medium-high heat. Once warmed, add the portobello mushrooms along with any remaining marinade* and cook on each side for 4-5 minutes, or until softened and a deep golden brown. Gently flip the mushrooms as they will be fragile!⁣ 5. Serve warm with sides of choice. This goes well with mashed potatoes or our fall rice pilaf!⁣ ⁣ Notes⁣ * We grilled asparagus to serve alongside our portobello mushroom steaks. Instead of pouring the remaining marinade in with the mushrooms, we saved it and used it to marinate the asparagus. This vegan pumpkin pie requires just 10 ingredients, 10 minutes to prepare and 1 hour to bake 🥰 Recipe is below and also linked in my story and bio ✨ ⁣ Ingredients⁣ * 1 cup (240 mL) almond milk* (see notes)⁣ * 1/4 cup (33 g) cornstarch⁣ * 1/3 cup (183 g) organic brown sugar⁣ * 1/3 cup (72 g) organic white sugar⁣ * 1 (15 oz.) can pumpkin puree (not pumpkin pie filling)⁣ * 1 tbsp (13 g) coconut oil⁣ * 2 1/4 tsp (3.9 g) pumpkin pie spice⁣ * 1/2 tsp (3 g) salt⁣ * 1 tsp (2 g) vanilla extract⁣ * Frozen pie crust* (see notes)⁣ Toppings (optional)⁣ * Coconut whipped cream (recipe on the blog)⁣ * Crushed pecans⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. Preheat oven to 350°F.⁣ 2. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, add in the almond milk and cornstarch. Whisk together until smooth, trying your best to break apart any cornstarch chunks.⁣ 3. Add in sugars, whisk, and bring to a simmer over low to medium-low heat. Whisk continuously to thicken the mixture, about 4 minutes.⁣ 4. Remove from heat and stir in the pumpkin puree, coconut oil, pumpkin pie spice, salt, and vanilla. Mix until smooth.⁣ 5. Grab your pie crust from the freezer and pour in the pumpkin pie filling, being sure to spread it all out with a spatula until smooth. Place the pie into the oven and for 1 hour, being sure to check on it every 5 minutes for the last 15 minutes to be sure it does not burn!⁣ 6. Set aside and allow it to cool completely before serving, preferably in the refrigerator overnight.⁣ 7. Serve with a garnish of crushed pecans and coconut whipped cream. Enjoy!⁣ ⁣ Notes⁣ * We used a frozen pie crust but you can definitely make your own! We crust recipes that we used in our apple pie or our date sweetened gluten free pumpkin pie, both on the blog. EASY VEGAN BROCCOLI CHEDDAR SOUP 🥦 A veganized version of the Panera classic and call me crazy but I think this might be better 😍 This is perfect for the cold fall and winter months and it only takes 40 minutes to make! It’s super creamy, decadent, flavor packed AND it’s made with whole food ingredients and nothing funky. The recipe is below and also linked in my bio! ✨ ⁣ Ingredients⁣ * 1 cup raw cashews, soaked overnight* (see notes)⁣ * 2 cups filtered water⁣ * 1/2 cup nutritional yeast⁣ * 1 tbsp fresh lemon juice⁣ * 3 1/4 cups vegan chicken broth or vegetable broth of your choice (see notes)⁣ * 1/2 medium onion, finely diced⁣ * 1 rib celery, finely diced⁣ * 2 cloves garlic, finely minced⁣ * 2 3/4 cups finely chopped broccoli⁣ * 1 cup carrot, julienned⁣ * 1/4 tsp nutmeg⁣ * 1 tsp salt, plus more to taste⁣ * Black pepper, to taste⁣ Garnishes (optional)⁣ * Fresh parsley⁣ * Vegan croutons⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. Drain the cashews and transfer them to a high speed blender along with 2 cups of water, nutritional yeast, and lemon juice. Blend on high until smooth and set aside.⁣ 2. In a large pot over medium heat, add 2 tbsp of vegetable broth along with the onions and celery. Sauté until softened, about 3 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 2 minutes more, adding 2 more tbsp of vegetable broth as needed to prevent burning.⁣ 3. Add the remaining vegetable broth to the pot along with the blended cashew mixture and mix until uniform. Add the broccoli, carrots and nutmeg and mix again until combined. Bring to a boil and lower to a simmer. Cook for 15-20 minutes, stirring often, until the soup has thickened.⁣ 4. Remove it from the heat and season with salt and pepper to taste.⁣ 5. Serve warm with a garnish parsley and croutons. ⁣ Notes⁣ * You can quick soak cashews in hot water as well: Bring a small pot of water to a boil, remove from heat and add in the cashews. Soak for 20 minutes or until softened and drain.⁣ * We used Better than Bouillon vegan chicken broth paste and mixed 3 1/4 cups water with 3 1/4 tsp paste.⁣ ⁣ https://user_34.com/2019/03/broccoli-cheddar-soup/ #vegan #Panera #broccolicheddarsoup #user_34 #feedfeed #fallsoup #wintersoup

It’s #WorldMentalHealthDay and I just wanted to send a reminder that even if you don’t have a mental illness, mental health is just as important as physical health and we need to end the stigma around it ✨⁣ ⁣ If you have been following me for a while, you might know that when I was 18 I struggled with an eating disorder and depression. I felt alone, scared and SO uncomfortable with myself...I didn’t even share what was going on with my best friends and family because I already felt judged and misunderstood by societal views of mental health and illness. Instead of accepting the situation and seeking help, I, instead, blamed myself for what was going on in my head and constantly criticized and judged myself— it was a viscous cycle that dug me deeper into the hole I was already in.⁣ ———————⁣ If I could go back in time and talk to myself, I would tell myself this: ⁣ ⁣ It’s okay to to not be okay! Life isn’t all about being happy, bubbly, and perfectly “curated” all the time like we often see online. You don’t have to force yourself to look or act a certain way for anyone; instead focus on accepting what’s going on in your life and understanding that everyone goes through hard times. ⁣ ⁣ Remember that it does not make you any less brave or strong to seek help, but actually, the exact opposite. Don’t ever be ashamed to talk about your mental health or reach out to others when you’re in a time of need. There are SO many people in your life that love you and would want to help you during this time, you just need to open up and let them in. ⁣ ——————⁣ I read a conversation with Kristen Bell talking about how mental health check-ins should be as routine as going to the doctor or the dentist and I 100% agree! I think we all should also remember to check in with our family and friends, even if it means just reaching out and letting them know that we love them and are thinking of them. Let them know that we are here for them if they ever need us because a this small action can make all the difference.⁣ ⁣ We need to help those struggling with mental illness by encouraging more conversation regarding mental health so we can end the stigma. 🖤 #user_34

Preheat oven to 350°F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat. This recipe makes 3 dozen so you will need to bake in batches. See notes for freezing options.⁣⁣ 2. In a large bowl, mix together the vegan butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar, pumpkin and vanilla. Stir in the flour, baking soda, baking powder, pumpkin pie spice and salt until a dough forms. Fold in chocolate chips until well incorporated.⁣⁣ 3. Optional: Set the dough into the fridge to chill. Since we are using melted vegan butter, the cookies on their own (unchilled) will be chewier and flatter cookies. If you would like them to spread less and be more cake like, set the dough in the fridge for 2 hours.⁣⁣ 4. Using a tablespoon sized scooper, drop mounds of dough onto the baking sheet 2 inches apart.⁣ 5. Bake for 13-14 minutes, or until the edges brown. The cookies will seem soft but don’t worry, they will firm up as they cool. Allow them to rest on the baking sheet for 1 minute and then transfer them to a cooling rack. ⁣If you're Looking for an easy and fuss-free vegan meal for dinner this week, I’ve got you covered 😋 Try this sheet pan lemon pepper & herb tofu with asparagus. It takes less than an hour to make and requires simple ingredients!⁣ ⁣ Ingredients⁣  Lemon Pepper and Herb Tofu with Asparagus⁣ * 1 (14 oz.) block extra firm tofu, pressed and cubed⁣ * 5 tablespoons fresh lemon juice⁣ * 5 cloves garlic, finely minced⁣ * 3 tablespoons vegetable broth⁣ * 1 tablespoon tamari (or soy sauce if not gluten free)⁣ * 1 tablespoon fresh chopped rosemary⁣ * 1 teaspoon fresh chopped sage⁣ * 1/2 teaspoon fresh chopped thyme⁣ * 1/2 teaspoon black pepper⁣ * 1/2 teaspoon salt⁣ * 1/4 teaspoon sriracha (or as desired)⁣ * 1 lb. asparagus, tough ends removed⁣ * 5 thinly sliced rounds of lemon⁣  Tahini Dressing⁣ * 1/3 to 1/2 cup water, or as needed to thin⁣ * 1/3 cup tahini⁣ * 2 to 3 tablespoons lemon juice⁣ * 2 teaspoons Dijon mustard⁣ * 1 1/2 teaspoons maple syrup⁣ * 1 to 1 1/2 teaspoons tamari (or soy sauce if not gluten free)⁣ * 1 teaspoon garlic powder⁣ * 1/4 teaspoon salt, or to taste⁣ * Fresh black pepper, to taste⁣  Serve with (optional)⁣ * Brown Rice⁣ * Sesame seeds⁣ * Green onions⁣ * Vegan Parmesan⁣ * Lemon slices (for garnish)⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. Once the tofu has marinated, carefully remove it from the bowl/bag (reserving the leftover marinade) and transfer it onto the left side of the baking sheet in a single layer. Tag a friend below plus make sure ya bookmark this to make later 🌚 These are the perfect on-the-go vegan snack or breakfast and make a great addition to weekly meal prep!⁣⁣⁣ ⁣ Ingredients⁣⁣⁣ Wet⁣⁣⁣ * 1 flax egg (1 tbsp flaxseed meal + 3 tbsp water)⁣⁣⁣ * 1/2 cup almond butter (or nut butter of choice)⁣⁣⁣ * 1/2 cup maple syrup⁣⁣⁣ * 1/2 cup unsweetened almond milk⁣⁣⁣ Dry⁣⁣⁣ * 1 cup oat flour⁣ * 1/2 cup gluten-free rolled oats⁣⁣⁣ * ⅓ cup unsweetened coconut flakes⁣⁣⁣ * 1/3 cup chopped hazelnuts (or nuts of choice)⁣⁣⁣ * 1/2 cup vegan vanilla protein powder⁣⁣⁣ * 1/3 cup dark chocolate chips⁣⁣⁣ * 1 tbsp hemp hearts⁣⁣⁣ * 1 tbsp chia seeds⁣ * 1/2 tsp cinnamon⁣⁣⁣ * 1/4 tsp sea salt⁣⁣⁣ Other⁣⁣⁣ * * Coconut oil spray⁣⁣⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣⁣⁣ 1. Preheat oven to 350°F and lightly spray a medium-sized baking dish* with coconut oil spray.⁣⁣⁣ 2. I didn’t go vegan overnight, it actually took me a little while to transition animals products out and vegan alternatives in but THAT’S OKAY. I used to beat myself up about it when I was in the process and for some reason felt embarrassed because I didn’t have the “willpower” to go cold turkey (for lack of a better term), but I realized that small changes are still changes and they still affect the bigger picture. ⁣ ⁣ (Before I forget, pictured is the vegan pastrami sandwich from @counterpartdeli in LA lol)⁣ ⁣ I was still making a difference, and if you are in the same boat, you are too! If I made a huge change overnight, it would not have been sustainable for me and I would have bounced right back to eating animal products because I would have been convinced it was “too hard” to change. With my slow transition, I was able to take things one step at a time, at a pace that was feasible with my lifestyle, and I was able to form new habits and break old ones without feeling overwhelmed 🤷🏽‍♀️⁣ ⁣ Making changes to something as intrinsic as a diet is tough! It’s not just choosing different foods to put on your plate, but it’s also breaking and changes lifelong habits and even traditions. I come from an Ecuadorian and Filipino background so trust me, I know!😩⁣ ⁣ It’s more important than ever before that we push ourselves to make changes on our plate — to do better for our planet, our health and the animals. 🌎 I’m not one to aggressively push veganism on people or be “preachy”, but I just hope that the fires in the Amazon help people see how much destruction is caused by our consumption and dietary choices. The fires were no accident and it weren’t a natural occurrence. And, they are the most devastating fires to date. If you didn’t know, fires are intentionally started to clear land for cattle ranching, soy (mostly fed to animals of the industry), palm oil, and other uses. If we can change our habits and decrease the demand for these products, we can do our part in working to do better for our planet. ⁣ ⁣ Thanks for reading this random rant through if you made it this far, and happy Tuesday 😬🖤🙏🏼 #user_34 #counterpartdeli #amazon #vegan

Celebrating summer with this easy vegan summer stew ✨ This was probably one of my favorite recipes that we made last summer and that’s because it was easy to make, the perfect way to highlight some of the summer produce that we had in our fridge and easy to make! It’s from the @veganyackattack On The Go Cookbook! Definitely a book that is great for those of you new to the kitchen or who just want quick meals! She was nice enough to let us share the recipe with ya so I’ll link it in my bio and also share it below 😊  Ingredients⁣ * 1 tablespoon (15 ml) sunflower oil⁣ * 1 cup (140 g) diced onion⁣ * 2 cups (280 g) chopped zucchini⁣ * 4 ounces (120 g) green beans⁣ * 2 large carrots, sliced into rounds*⁣ * 2 cloves garlic, minced⁣ * 3 cups (500 g) chopped tomatoes⁣ * 1½ cups (315 g) cooked corn kernels⁣ * 2 cans (30 ounces, or 850 g) white beans, plus liquid⁣ * 1 cup (235 ml) low-sodium vegetable broth⁣ * 1 teaspoon dried basil, or more to taste⁣ * ½ teaspoon dried parsley, or more to taste⁣ * 1/8 teaspoon black pepper, or more to taste⁣ * Pinch of crushed red pepper (optional)⁣ * 1 teaspoon salt, or to taste⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. Warm the oil in a large pot over medium heat. Once hot, add the onions, zucchini, and green beans to the pot, sautéing for 5 minutes or until the onions are mostly translucent. Recipe is below and also on our blog, linked in my bio 🍓  Ingredients⁣ * 3 cups frozen strawberries* (see notes)⁣ * 3/4 cup unsweetened plain vegan yogurt* (see notes)⁣ * 1 teaspoons vanilla extract⁣ * 3 to 4 tablespoons maple syrup (or as desired)⁣ * Optional: fresh mint, for garnish⁣ ⁣ Instructions⁣ 1. Add all of the ingredients (except for the mint) into a high speed blender or food processor and blend until smooth and creamy, stopping to scrape down the sides as needed. Adjust the sweetness to taste.⁣ 2. Serve immediately or transfer it to an airtight container and place it into the freezer for 2-3 hours to harden up a bit (as pictured above). You can store the vegan frozen yogurt in an airtight container in the freezer for up to 1 month, just be sure to leave it out for 10-15 minutes to soften.⁣ ⁣ ⁣ Notes⁣ * You can use store bought frozen strawberries OR fresh frozen strawberries for this recipe. To freeze strawberries at home, line a large baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat. Remove the stems from your strawberries and half them, then lay them out in a single layer on the baking sheet and place that into the refrigerator until the strawberries are frozen solid, about 8 hours or overnight.⁣ * If you would like, you could use medjool dates in place of the maple syrup but just keep in mind that you may need to add a few tablespoons of water to get things going if there isn’t enough liquid to blend it.⁣ * You can use sweetened and flavored yogurt, just keep in mind that this will alter the flavor of the frozen yogurt in the end. If you are using sweetened yogurt, you will need to adjust the maple syrup or remove it all together based on your preference. If you are using vanilla yogurt, the addition of vanilla extract may not be necessary.⁣ * If you prefer not to use strawberries, try 3 cups of your favorite fruit (frozen)! Took this little booger out for the day and he did pretty dang good 🖤 I usually don’t talk about dog stuff but let’s talk about dog stuff. We rescued Berry after his family was abandoned in a trailer park in California and our # 1 goal has always been to give him the best life possible. And that doesn’t just mean showering him with treats and all the cuddles in the world, but it also means dedicating time and effort to helping him work through some problems and to become a more confident and less anxious/nervous pup. I’ve learned a lot about dogs in the last few years of being his mama and the best tips I can give you are 1. Remember that the energy you share with your pup is the most important tool you have. If you’re on edge when taking your dog out and about, your dog will feed off of that and think that they should be on edge, too. When we are calm and confident in Berry, he is usually calm and confident in himself. Patience is key!✨ 2. Celebrate the small wins your pup has each and every day 3. Work with someone who is as dedicated to your dog as you are. We had no idea where to start with little B and our friends @pasadenapaws, @oregontails and @packlife_la helped set the foundation for us. All three of them post a lot of helpful information and I definitely recommend you check them out 🐶 4. Consider getting a “do not pet” harness to put on your dog while you’re out working with them. It makes a huge difference and in our experience most people are respectful of it 🙏🏼 We have also just gotten used to letting people know Berry doesn’t like strangers coming up to him and he needs his space. It’s used to be awkward at first but I’m much more confident now as I know it will help Berry. 5. Lastly, stay consistent. It takes time and We still have a lot to work through with this guy, but he has made so much progress since we started! 🖤
